column1: Standing cable low-to-high twist//strength//abdominals//cable//Connect a standard handle on a tower
column2: and move the cable to the lowest pulley position. With your side to the cable
column3: grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately armâ€™s length away from the pulley
column4: with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable. With your feet positioned shoulder width apart
column5: squat down and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended. In one motion
column6: pull the handle up and across your body until your arms are in a fully-extended position above your head. Keep your back straight and your arms close to your body as you pivot your back foot and straighten your legs to get a full range of motion. Retract your arms and then your body. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat to failure. Then
column7: reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.  Tip: You will twist your entire body with this exercise
column8: but focus on getting maximal torso rotation and a strong clinch at the end of the movement. To ensure a good mind-muscle connection
column9: keep your abs tense at all times.

column1: Dumbbell spell caster//strength//abdominals//dumbbell//Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a pronated grip. Your feet should be wide with your hips and knees extended. This will be your starting position. Begin the movement by pulling both of the dumbbells to one side next to your hip
column2: rotating your torso. Keeping your arms straight and the dumbbells parallel to the ground
column3: rotate your torso to swing the weights to your opposite side. Continue alternating
column4: rotating from one side to the other until the set is complete.

column1: Clam//strength//abductors//None//Begin by lying on your side on the ground. Support your head on your left arm. Flex the hips to 45 degrees and the knees to approximately 90 degrees
column2: with your right leg directly on top of your left. This will be your starting position. Initiate the exercise by abducting your right leg
column3: pushing your knee away from the midline of your body. Maintain contact between your feet throughout the movement. Pause at the top of the motion
column4: and then return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Do both sides.

column1: Decline reverse crunch//strength//abdominals//other//Lie on your back on a decline bench and hold on to the top of the bench with both hands. Don't let your body slip down from this position. Hold your legs parallel to the floor using your abs to hold them there while keeping your knees and feet together. Tip: Your legs should be fully extended with a slight bend on the knee. This will be your starting position. While exhaling
column2: move your legs towards the torso as you roll your pelvis backwards and you raise your hips off the bench. At the end of this movement your knees will be touching your chest. Hold the contraction for a second and move your legs back to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.  Variations: You can do the movement on a flat surface and as you get more advanced you can use ankle weights.

column1: Spider crawl//strength//abdominals//body_only//Begin in a prone position on the floor. Support your weight on your hands and toes
column2: with your feet together and your body straight. Your arms should be bent to 90 degrees. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement by raising one foot off of the ground. Externally rotate the leg and bring the knee toward your elbow
column3: as far forward as possible. Return this leg to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.

column1: Cocoons//strength//abdominals//body_only//Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms extended behind your head. This will be your starting position. To perform the movement
column2: tuck the knees toward your chest
column3: rotating your pelvis to lift your glutes from the floor. As you do so
column4: flex the spine
column5: bringing your arms back over your head to perform a simultaneous crunch motion. After a brief pause

column1: Hip Circles (Prone)//stretching//abductors//None//Position yourself on your hands and knees on the ground. Maintaining good posture
column2: raise one bent knee off of the ground. This will be your starting position. Keeping the knee in a bent position
column3: rotate the femur in an arc
column4: attempting to make a big circle with your knee. Perform this slowly for a number of repetitions
column5: and repeat on the other side.

column1: Standing Hip Circles//stretching//abductors//body_only//Begin standing on one leg
column2: holding to a vertical support. Raise the unsupported knee to 90 degrees. This will be your starting position. Open the hip as far as possible
column3: attempting to make a big circle with your knee. Perform this movement slowly for a number of repetitions
column4: and repeat on the other side.

column1: Landmine twist//strength//abdominals//other//Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight. Raise the bar from the floor
column2: taking it to shoulder height with both hands with your arms extended in front of you. Adopt a wide stance. This will be your starting position. Perform the movement by rotating the trunk and hips as you swing the weight all the way down to one side. Keep your arms extended throughout the exercise. Reverse the motion to swing the weight all the way to the opposite side. Continue alternating the movement until the set is complete.

column1: Elbow plank//strength//abdominals//body_only//Get into a prone position on the floor
column2: supporting your weight on your toes and your forearms. Your arms are bent and directly below the shoulder. Keep your body straight at all times
column3: and hold this position as long as possible. To increase difficulty
column4: an arm or leg can be raised.

column1: Bottoms Up//strength//abdominals//body_only//Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms at your side. This will be your starting position. To perform the movement
column2: tuck the knees toward your chest by flexing the hips and knees. Following this
column3: extend your legs directly above you so that they are perpendicular to the ground. Rotate and elevate your pelvis to raise your glutes from the floor. After a brief pause
column4: return to the starting position.

column1: Suspended ab fall-out//strength//abdominals//other//Adjust the straps so the handles are at an appropriate height
column2: below waist level. Begin standing and grasping the handles. Lean into the straps
column3: moving to an incline push-up position. This will be your starting position. Keeping your arms straight
column4: lean further into the suspension straps
column5: bringing your body closer to the ground
column7: raising your arms up and over your head. Maintain a neutral spine and keep the rest of your body straight
column8: your shoulders being the only joints allowed to move. Pause during the peak contraction
column9: and then return to the starting position.

column1: Dumbbell V-Sit Cross Jab//strength//abdominals//dumbbell//"Begin seated on your butt with your knees bent and feet on the ground. Lean your upper body back to form a 45-degree angle with the floor. Bring your feet off the ground so that your body resembles a ""V"" shape. Grasp a dumbbell in each hand and hold tight to your chest with palms facing each other. This will be your starting position. While keeping your core tight and maintaining your body's ""V"" position
column2: quickly extend your left arm straight out (similar to a jab) and then bring it back to the starting position while simultaneously punching out with the right arm. Your torso and legs may slightly rotate side to side opposite of your hands throughout the movementâ€”this is okay. A punch with each hand counts as one total repetition. Repeat for recommended number of repetitions."

column1: Iliotibial band SMR//stretching//abductors//foam_roll//Lay on your side
column2: with the bottom leg placed onto a foam roller between the hip and the knee. The other leg can be crossed in front of you. Place as much of your weight as is tolerable onto your bottom leg; there is no need to keep your bottom leg in contact with the ground. Be sure to relax the muscles of the leg you are stretching. Roll your leg over the foam from you hip to your knee
column3: pausing for 10-30 seconds at points of tension. Repeat with the opposite leg.

column1: Thigh abductor//strength//abductors//machine//To begin
column2: sit down on the abductor machine and select a weight you are comfortable with. When your legs are positioned properly
column3: grip the handles on each side. Your entire upper body (from the waist up) should be stationary. This is the starting position. Slowly press against the machine with your legs to move them away from each other while exhaling. Feel the contraction for a second and begin to move your legs back to the starting position while breathing in. Note: Remember to keep your upper body stationary to prevent any injuries from occurring. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

column5: and repeat on the other side.

column1: Windmills//stretching//abductors//body_only//Lie on your back with your arms extended out to the sides and your legs straight. This will be your starting position. Lift one leg and quickly cross it over your body
column2: attempting to touch the ground near the opposite hand. Return to the starting position
column3: and repeat with the opposite leg. Continue to alternate for 10-20 repetitions.

column1: Monster Walk//strength//abductors//body_only//Place a band around both ankles and another around both knees. There should be enough tension that they are tight when your feet are shoulder width apart. To begin
column2: take short steps forward alternating your left and right foot. After several steps
column3: do just the opposite and walk backward to where you started.

column1: Single-leg lying cross-over stretch//stretching//abductors//body_only//Lie on your back with your legs extended. Cross one leg over your body with the knee bent
column2: attempting to touch the knee to the ground. Your partner should kneel beside you
column3: holding your shoulder down with one hand and controlling the crossed leg with the other. this will be your starting position. Attempt to raise the bent knee off of the ground as your partner prevents any actual movement. After 10-20 seconds
column4: relax the leg as your partner gently presses the knee towards the floor. Repeat with the other side.
